page.title: 15St. Mary's Church.
page.content: The original Church in Olveston was built during the transitional Norman period (c.117O). There is evidence of an ecclesiastical establishment as early as the reign of Edwin(617-633) and therefore a possibility of an earlier Church. Today Mrs.Caroline Roe is the Deaconess of St. Mary's Church, Olveston. She also takes services at nearby villages of Almondsbury, Alveston, Aust, Elberton and Littleton. Not only does she take services but also morning prayer, evening prayer, baptisms and funerals. She is not allowed to take weddings and Holy Communions. There is a close relationship between the village school and the Church. Mrs.Roe has been a Deaconess for a year and 3 weeks. She finds Olveston village very friendly.
